knimeNode.name: Impala Connector
knimeNode.shortDescription: Create a database connection to Impala.

fullDescription.intro: This node creates a connection to a Impala server via its JDBC driver. You need to provide the server's hostname (or IP address), the port, and a database name. Login credentials can either be provided directly in the configuration or via credentials set on the workflow.

tab.name: Connection settings
tab.option: Choose the registered database dialect here.

Choose the registered database driver here. Additional drivers can be registered via KNIME's preference page "KNIME -> Databases".
The node supports the usage of the Apache Hive drivers (already included in KNIME) and Cloudera JDBC drivers which are available for download from the Cloudera homepage.
The hostname (or IP address) of a Impala server.
The port on which the Impala server is listening. The default port is 21,050.
The name of the database you want to connect to.
If checked, the authentication is not required.

If checked, the credentials (user and password) are used as defined on the workflow. The credential name links to the specified user and password. Those can be replaced or edited the 'Workflow Credentials' menu available in the workflow's context menu.
Your log-in user name for the database.
Your log-in user name and password for the database. Note that the password is encrypted before storage and decrypted afterwards for being used internally.

Uses an existing Kerberos ticket for authentication. When connecting to Impala the principal of the Impala user needs to be added in the Parameter tab e.g. principal=impala/impala_host@YOUR-REALM.COM. The principal must be the same user principal you used when starting the Impala Server. For details see the Hive documentation or the Cloudera JDBC Driver for Apache Impala Install Guide.

tab.name: JDBC Parameters
tab.description: This tab allows you define JDBC driver connection parameter. The value of a parameter can be a constant, variable, credential user, credential password or KNIME URL. For more information about the supported driver properties see the Hive documentation or the Cloudera JDBC Driver for Apache Impala Install Guide.

tab.name: Advanced
tab.description: This tab allows you to define KNIME framework properties such as connection handling, advanced SQL dialect settings or logging options.

tab.name: Input Type Mapping
tab.description: This tab allows you to define rules to map from database types to KNIME types.
tab.option: Columns that match the given name (or regular expression) and database type will be mapped to the specified KNIME type.
Columns that match the given database type will be mapped to the specified KNIME type.

tab.name: Output Type Mapping
tab.description: This tab allows you to define rules to map from KNIME types to database types.
tab.option: Columns that match the given name (or regular expression) and KNIME type will be mapped to the specified database type.
Columns that match the given KNIME type will be mapped to the specified database type.
